title: How to Find Your Sleep Number

steps.title: Lie down on your Sleep Number bed in your favorite, most comfortable sleeping position.
steps.content: Lie down on your Sleep Number bed in your favorite, most comfortable sleeping position. Your favorite sleeping position is often the same position you wake up in.

steps.title: Adjust your pillow to your liking, and mimic how you normally like to fall asleep.
steps.content: Adjust your pillow to your liking, and mimic how you normally like to fall asleep.

steps.title: Press the “L” or “R” button on the Sleep Number remote to select your side of the bed.
steps.content: Press the “L” or “R” button on the Sleep Number remote to select your side of the bed. For example, if you sleep on the right side of the bed, press the “R” button.

steps.title: Use the remote to set the Sleep Number to 100, which is the firmest setting.
steps.content: Use the remote to set the Sleep Number to 100, which is the firmest setting. By default, the Sleep Number remote is set to 20, which is the “very soft” setting. The Sleep Number on the remote will slowly progress from 20 to 100, and the mattress will continue to grow firmer as the bed automatically adjusts to its firmest setting. Alternately, press “Menu,” select “Settings,” select “Find Your Sleep Number,” and follow the on-screen instructions on your remote to find your ideal Sleep Number. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Take note of your comfort level, as well as how your neck, shoulders, hips, and back feel as the mattress becomes firmer.
steps.content: Take note of your comfort level, as well as how your neck, shoulders, hips, and back feel as the mattress becomes firmer. The optimal goal is to find a Sleep Number that offers full body alignment and support. Side sleepers: Select a Sleep Number that makes your shoulders and hips feel cradled, and your stomach and ribs feel supported. Back sleepers: Select a Sleep Number that supports your lower back, and that allows for your shoulders and hips to sink slightly into the bed instead of resting on top of the bed. Stomach sleepers: Opt for a firmer Sleep Number setting that supports your back and prevents your stomach from sinking too low into the mattress. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press the “Stop” button on the Sleep Number remote when your body feels comfortably supported by the mattress.
steps.content: Press the “Stop” button on the Sleep Number remote when your body feels comfortably supported by the mattress.

steps.title: Press the “Up” and “Down” buttons on the remote to experiment with your overall comfort level in increments of five or 10.
steps.content: Press the “Up” and “Down” buttons on the remote to experiment with your overall comfort level in increments of five or 10. This will help you choose a Sleep Number that aligns more ideally with your personal sleeping preferences.

steps.title: Test your new Sleep Number for two or three nights, or until you’ve had enough time to properly assess your sleep quality.
steps.content: Test your new Sleep Number for two or three nights, or until you’ve had enough time to properly assess your sleep quality. If you are still not satisfied with your Sleep Number, adjust the number slightly up or down as needed until you find an ideal setting that works best for you. [3] X Research source
